page.title: 07Old Buildings in Ash.
page.content: Ash has many fine old buildings. When the original Domesday Book survey was undertaken the village had 18 inhabitants. It has now increased by about a thousand-fold. Ash Manor and St Peter's Church are mentioned in the original Domesday Book and have separate pages devoted to them. Other buildings of historic interest are 'Hartshorn' next to the church built around 1350, 'Azor Place' (formerly 'Bricklyn') and 'Merryworth' both dating to Elizabethan times. Many of the local inns are also very old. 'The Nightingale' and 'The Cannon' are both 400 years old and 'The Greyhound' is 300 years old.
